issue.title: Is there a CPP client available?
issue.body:
I would like to run some remote CPP benchmarking using this key-value store. 

I wonder if there are any remote CPP clients available. I think this hasn't been implemented for CPP, but is that accurate?

Thanks,
Alireza

issue.title: Immutable records with mangled keys returned during key iteration
issue.body:
I have a key/value store using `FasterKV<SpanByte, SpanByte>`. I've observed that, when upserting existing entries, I'm sometimes left with additional and unexpected records that are visible when I perform key iteration but always have their `Found` flag to set false if I try and get or delete the key, meaning that I can't remove them.

What I have observed about these records is:
- They are always located in the non-mutable section of the log memory (`IScanIteratorFunctions<SpanByte, SpanByte>.SingleReader` is always called for the "bad" entries, whereas `ConcurrentReader` is always called for the "good" entries).
- The `RecordInfo.Dirty` flag for the record is always `true` for a bad record and `false` for a good record.
- The key in a bad record always matches the first 8 characters of a good record but then replaces the remaining characters in the key with `NUL` characters (e.g. if a good key is `RULEREPOSITORY:RULES`, a mangled key might be `RULEREPO\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000\u0000`).
- If I examine the value of a rogue entry during key iteration, I can see that it appears to contain data from an old record.

Any suggestions about what is going on here and how I can remove these rogue entries? Thanks!

issue.title: Trying to build a simplified wrapper for a KV store but really don't understand from the docs what's going on.

comment.body:
> In every log-based KV system, if you want to control the expiration of items (instead of letting them expire automatically), you need to invoke compaction (or tune a compaction period). This isn't as complex

Thanks for your comment, It grasps the points not clearly mentioned in the official documentation.

forkee.name: FASTER
forkee.description: Fast persistent recoverable log and key-value store + cache, in C# and C++.

issue.title: Checkpoints get deleted on recovery
Failure to resume previous session on restart
issue.body:
Given a class that:

- Wraps a FASTER store with string keys, reference values
- Also wraps a singleton session, used for the lifetime of the application
- Waits for pending commands on all actions (RMW, Add, Delete)
- Checkpoints every `x` seconds on a background thread
- Evicts stale data every `y` hours on a background thread
- Will attempt to resume the session at startup

Are there any scenarios in which the 'Test' session will fail to be resumed after an unexpected error and automatic restart moments later?

issue.title: Full checkpoint deletes only one log file

comment.body: I ended up writing a code to automatically remove files with segment number < BeginAddress or > Head or Tail Address segments after checkpoints.

issue.title: Full checkpoint deletes only one log file

comment.body: I tried calling `TakeFullCheckpointAsync` instead and it completed in seconds but no log files were removed at all this time.

issue.title: Full checkpoint deletes only one log file

comment.body: It looks like checkpoint state machine hangs and never changes from 21 to 37 state
